column4: if you want to be a sysadmin, learn perl. if you want to be a programmer, learn python
if you want to be a computer nerd, learn both
anyone get Miro to work in Jaunty? did it require any special magics?
i just apt-get installed'd it...and it works
hmmm, it just dies silently, doesn't start. any idea how to start looking at what might be causing that? Running it with --debug isn't helpful
rin it from a terminal.. it runs fine here  version --> Miro 2.0.3 (r9307)

i do run it from term. it just doesn't print anything, doesn't do anything, returns me to command prompt. if I run it with --debug, it starts it in GDB, which tells me that the "Program exited normally."
clean install here, and all i did was apt-get install miro, so not sure what to tell ya
could you do me a favour? run miro with --debug from the command line and let me know if it shows you a bunch of gtcache.gettext warnings
cause maybe they aren't warnings, but errors, and that's where to start looking
and did it start up just fine, then say "program exited normally" when you close the program?
it ran find..  then i closed it
cool man, thanks for your help. so it confirms my suspicions that the gettext messages are just warnings...but brings me no closer to figuring out what's going on...
try it as a new user?
